Package SortedList

Class SortedLinkedList<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>

java.lang.Object
SortedList.AbstractSortedList<E>
SortedList.SortedLinkedList<E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
SortedList.SortedList<E>
public class SortedLinkedList<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>
extends SortedList.AbstractSortedList<E>
Implementation of a SortedList using a SinglyLinkedList
Since:
10/16/2021
Version:
2.0
Author:
Fernando J. Bermudez, Juan O. Lopez, Sebastian J. Caballero Diaz

  • Constructor Details

    • SortedLinkedList

      public SortedLinkedList()

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add​(E e)
      Inserts the element e into a new node. If the head is null, the head is now the newNode. If the new value is the smallest, then the newNode becomes the head. Loops through the list to add this new node before the value that it should be added.
      Specified by:
      add in interface SortedList.SortedList<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>
      Specified by:
      add in class SortedList.AbstractSortedList<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>
      Parameters:
      e - Element with value to be inserted into the list

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(E e)
      If the element e is found in the nodes, it's removed and the currentSize is updated. After removal, the nodes that were next and previous of the removed node are connected. When the value is found at the head node, head becomes the node after head, and the head is cleared, returning true. The method loops through the list and if it doesn't find e, returns false
      Specified by:
      remove in interface SortedList.SortedList<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>
      Specified by:
      remove in class SortedList.AbstractSortedList<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>
      Parameters:
      e - Element to be removed
      Returns:
      True if it has been found and removed, false otherwise.

    • removeIndex

      public E removeIndex​(int index)
      Like remove, but this time it searches by index instead of by the element itself to remove a node. When it reaches the index, it removes the node in this index and connects the other nodes.
      Specified by:
      removeIndex in interface SortedList.SortedList<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>
      Specified by:
      removeIndex in class SortedList.AbstractSortedList<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>
      Parameters:
      index - The index in the list of the node to be removed
      Returns:
      The value that got removed

    • firstIndex

      public int firstIndex​(E e)
      This method uses a value to search in the list, and returns the first index where this value is located. Loops through the list, returning -1 if the value is not found.
      Specified by:
      firstIndex in interface SortedList.SortedList<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>
      Specified by:
      firstIndex in class SortedList.AbstractSortedList<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>
      Parameters:
      e - Element to be found
      Returns:
      The index of the element that was looked for, or -1 if the element wasn't found

    • get

      public E get​(int index)
      Looks for the index specified, and returns the element found in this index. If after looping the index isn't found, returns null
      Specified by:
      get in interface SortedList.SortedList<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>
      Specified by:
      get in class SortedList.AbstractSortedList<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>
      Parameters:
      index - The index to search for the element to return
      Returns:
      The value that was in the position of the index specified.

    • toArray

      public E[] toArray()
      Description copied from interface: SortedList.SortedList
      Temporary method to return the list as an array, for testing and debugging.
      Specified by:
      toArray in interface SortedList.SortedList<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>
      Specified by:
      toArray in class SortedList.AbstractSortedList<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>
      Returns:
      Array with a copy of the elements
